title: Aussies Celebrate Christmas Nationwide With Santa Surprises And Festive Scenes | 10 News
description: From coast to coast, Australians marked Christmas Day with Santa spreading joy to children - and even pets - across the country.  The man in red delivered plenty of surprises, including celebrity appearances and an unexpected dusting of snow in one part of the nation. title: Rare White Christmas As Snow Hits Tasmania For First Time In Decades | 10 News
description: While many headed for the beach, sunshine was in short supply in the nation’s south, where Tasmanians experienced a rare white Christmas.  It’s the first time snow has fallen in Australia on December 25 in almost two decades. title: Subdued Christmas Day At Bondi As Crowds Return After Tragedy | 10 News
description: Usually the epicentre of coastal celebrations, Christmas at Bondi was noticeably subdued this year.  Thousands still made their way to the beach, seeking moments of joy after weeks of darkness. title: Jewish Community Shaken After Melbourne Rabbi’s Car Firebombed | 10 News
description: The Jewish community has been left shaken once again after a prominent Melbourne rabbi’s car was firebombed overnight.  Community leaders have condemned the attack as another act of antisemitism, saying enough is enough. title: Boxing Day Test Draws 93,000 Fans Amid Heavy Security At The MCG | 10 News
description: A record crowd of more than 93,000 has descended on the Melbourne Cricket Ground for the first day of the Boxing Day Test.  And just as authorities warned, there was a heavy police presence amid heightened security concerns.  But for fans who travelled from across the country - and around the world - there was no dampening the excitement, as England dominated early. title: Bondi Grief And Rabbi Car Firebombing Spark Royal Commission Pressure | 10 News
description: Police have named a homeless man as a person of interest over the firebombing of a Melbourne rabbi’s car, as investigations continue into the antisemitic attack.  The development comes amid growing pressure on the federal government to launch a royal commission, nearly two weeks after the Bondi terror attack.  Meanwhile, the mother of a French national killed in the Bondi massacre says her “heart is in a thousand pieces”.  Dan Elkayam was laid to rest in Israel, remembered by his family as a hero who loved life. title: Mother And Stepson Rescued After Drifting 10km Out To Sea Near Melbourne | 10 News
description: A mother and her stepson have survived more than three hours clinging to paddleboards in the ocean near Melbourne, drifting 10 kilometres before rescue crews pulled them to safety.  Victorian search teams were kept busy on Christmas Day, with six people rescued from potentially deadly situations. title: Coogee Beach Trashed By Christmas Revellers, Locals Lead Clean-Up | 10 News
description: A Sydney mayor has been left furious, saying his “pristine” beach was turned into a “pigsty” by thousands of Christmas Day revellers.  Locals today pitched in to clean-up the mess, which is becoming somewhat of an annual tradition. title: World Celebrate Christmas As King Charles Attends Church, Pope Calls For Peace | 10 News
description: As Australia makes the most of the Boxing Day public holiday - the rest of the world has celebrated Christmas.  King Charles, Queen Camila along with the Royal Family have taken part in their yearly church service - with one big absence, the former Prince Andrew.  Meantime Pope Leo has called for an end to all wars in his first Christmas address since becoming pontiff. title: 14 Injured In Japan Factory Knife And Chemical Attack | 10 News
description: At least 14 people have been injured in a knife and chemical attack at a tyre factory in central Japan, in what authorities say was a targeted assault inside the workplace.  Police arrested a 38-year-old man for attempted murder after he allegedly stabbed eight people at the Yokohama Rubber Company plant in Mishima, west of Tokyo.  Emergency services say seven others were injured after a chemical believed to be bleach was thrown during the attack, with several workers taken to hospital for treatment.  Five of the stabbing victims remain in a serious condition, as investigators work to determine the suspect’s motive. title: Russian Strikes Hit Kharkiv And Uman, Killing Two And Injuring 14 | 10 News
description: Russian strikes on Kharkiv and Uman over December 25-26 have killed at least two people and injured 14, Ukrainian authorities say.  In Kharkiv, three guided bombs struck the city, including one that hit a central road, killing two men and injuring eight others, among them a nine-month-old baby.  Officials say the blast set vehicles on fire and shattered windows in nearby apartments, stressing the area contained only civilian buildings.  In central Ukraine, a missile strike on the city of Uman injured six people, including two children, and damaged dozens of homes. title: Bondi Victims’ Families Call For Royal Commission As Government Holds Line | 10 News
description: Relatives of victims of the Bondi Beach massacre have added to growing calls for a Commonwealth Royal Commission, saying they feel forgotten by the Prime Minister.  However, the federal government is holding firm, refusing to establish a national probe into the antisemitic attack, despite Foreign Minister Penny Wong delivering a personal apology. title: Police Swarm Cronulla After Online Threats Following Bondi Attack | 10 News
description: Police have swarmed one of Sydney’s most popular beaches after a social media post circulated online calling for a “mass bashing” in the wake of the Bondi attack.  Officers descended on Cronulla by land, air and sea, a location already marked by the legacy of past race riots. description: A rough opening night of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race has taken its toll, with 12 boats forced to retire, including one of the five super maxis. title: Zelenskyy To Meet US Leader As Kyiv Hit By Major Russian Attack | 10 News
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is preparing to meet with his US counterpart to discuss efforts to end the ongoing war.
